project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In the old classic boards there used to be a shortcut option (by pressing 'w') to update the priority of the issues. Now with the new rapid boards, the option is not there anymore. We need to go through the following steps : 
# select the issue
# hit "e" 
# hit "." 
# type "prio" & tab
# change the priority

Would be nice to get the shortcut back.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Shortcut to update priority missing on Rapid boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be useful to see the total of Story Points/Original Estimate for the Backlog as well. For now, it is only possible to see the total for the Sprints.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have the total of Story Points/Original Estimate on the Backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In Greenhopper 5, there was a link to Classic board via "More Actions -> Planning Board". Please see 
!Classic Board.PNG|thumbnail!

After upgrading to Greenhopper 6, the link was replaced to Rapid board. Please see
!Rapid Board.PNG|thumbnail!

Perhaps there is an improvement that can make this two links to be available in Greenhopper. 
* Either, the classic boards must show up in the "Agile -> View on board" as available boards or "More Actions -> Planning Board".
* A documentation of how to configure rapid boards to show exactly what the classic boards show.
fields.summary: View on board function not available for Classic Board Greenhopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
By default, a user needs the 'Edit Issues' and either the 'Schedule Issues' or the 'Resolve Issues' permission to schedule the version in Classic Board according the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Scheduling+and+Assigning+Issues+in+GreenHopper+Classic] here.

However, the user who does not have the Schedule Issues permission is able to schedule the version in JIRA.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Grant jira user with only the 'Edit Issues' and 'Resolved Issues' permission.
# Create a new issue and assign the issue to john.
# Edit the version in Classic Planning Board on DEMO-10 issue and this action results in an error message which is the expected behaviour. Please see the following image: 
!Insufficient_privileges.png|thumbnail!
# In DEMO-10 issue screen, john edits the Fix Version field to *"1.0"*, and then JIRA updates the issue version in Classic Planning Board. Please see the following image:
!edit_version.png|thumbnail!
!version_edited.PNG|thumbnail!
# Even when the GreenHopper General Configuration of *Scheduling Permission* is check or uncheck, it would not affect the problem here.
fields.summary: Able to schedule issue version in Classic Board when 'Schedule Issues' permission are not granted

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Per user requirements, would be feasible if 'Plan' view can support also completed sprints whereby users cab have the ability to view sprints tasks list on that view in sake of usability purpose.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to view completed sprints tasks list in the plan view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Epic Status custom field has three value 'To Do', 'In Progress' and 'Done'. While the meaning of first and last are obvious, the meaning of 'In Progress' is not defined anywhere. Also GreenHopper does not seem to change that field to 'In Progress' when the stories are being done.

We need to enhance the documentation about the purpose of that value.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Completing+an+Epic
fields.summary: Epic Documentation for 'In Progress' State

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The GreenHopper [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Supported+Platforms] documentation currently lists some incorrect information for JIRA 5.2.x (and possibly others) - it has the below for JIRA 5.2.X:

{quote}
(/) Supported with GreenHopper 5.9.x and 5.10.x and 6.0.x and 6.1.x
{quote}

However testing JIRA 5.2.5 and GH 5.10.6 did not work. Looking at the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira] link for GreenHopper, it does have the correct version information for GreenHopper 5.10.6, and as confirmed with the devs we should go off this matrix rather than the Support Platforms docs.

Can you please modify those docs so that they advise users to check the marketplace? I was going to change it myself but wasn't sure how to make it look the best.

Thanks! :)
fields.summary: Update Supported Platforms Documentation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
All builds take up to an hour. 

If they fail, somebody needs to try to fix them then wait an hour to see if they go green again. We check in on red builds because it's not practical to wait. 

It would be good to at least do the following:
1. separate the stages and have some kind of fast feedback (compile + unit tests at least)
2. figure out what is taking a long time and what we can do about it
fields.summary: Make the GH builds provide feedback more quickly

fields.description:
In the rapid board using the "plan" view you can see all epics in a special column on the left side of the screen. For each epic you can expand the view to see more details, e.g. the number of stories linked to that epic.

This view is quite nice to get a quick overview of an epic but lots of things are missing, such as:

- list of clickable issue ids linked to the epic
- logged work per issue
- sum of logged work of all linked issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This option:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Synchronising+Versions+and+Components+for+your+Issues

h5. The problem:
The version synchroniser field is ignored if GH's configuration

Affects GH 6.1.2

h5. Steps to Reproduce:
* Disable Version sync in GH's config
* Create new Project, let's use *DEMO*
* Add a version, let's use *v1*
* Create issue with *v1* set as the fixVersion
* Create sub-task from this issue
* Check sub-task, notice that fixVersion is defined as v1

h5. Workaround
* Ensure disable the project that you do not want versions to be copied
fields.summary: Verson Synchroniser option is ignored, always enabled

fields.summary: Right-clicking an issue in plan mode does not work as described

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
One of our Sprint teams reported an issue with the calculations in the Burndown Chart.

Some issues end up with negative remaining values which are wrong or cannot be explained.

I attached "burndown_chart_table_extract.docx" in which I meticulously collected screenshots of everything that happened to issue NSD-5919. As you can see, at sprint end, this issue has a Estimate Remaining value of -6.75h which seems incorrect. It should be 0 or perhaps 65h - 81.25h = -16.25h.

I also attached "jira_history.docx" in which I meticulously collected all time information for issue NSD-5919 under the JIRA issue history tab. I used this information to try to match and understand what GreenHopper does, and I am pretty sure that GreenHopper goes wrong somewhere, but I cannot pinpoint it.

I also tried hard to reproduce the error in order to give you steps to reproduce but I was not successful in doing so.

Could you please analyze my data and let me know your findings? As the original reporter said "Luckily the discrepancy arose so late in the sprint that it didn't affect planning, if it had happened earlier we may have been led to believe we had extra capacity!".
fields.summary: Incorrect Burndown chart values

Example:

GET /rest/greenhopper/1.0/api/board/1/issue?includeDone=true

{code}
[
    {
      "id": 10000,
      "key": "SSP-1",
      "hidden": false,
      "typeName": "Story",
      "typeId": "7",
      "summary": "As an Agile team, I'd like to learn about Scrum >> Click the \"SSP-1\" link at the left of this row to see detail in the Description tab on the right",
      "typeUrl": "http://localhost:2990/jira/images/icons/ico_story.png",

      "done": false,
      "color": "#66cc33",

]
{code}

It would be fine if this was part of a larger resource that also returns data about projects, sprints, markers, etc.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Install JIRA with GH 5.10.6 to MSSQL
# Create a new schema in the same database (other than dbo)
# Install JIRA with GH 5.10.6 to the new MSSQL database
# Upgrade the second JIRA to GH 6.1.2
# Attempt to index

When upgrading from 5.10.6, GH checked for the DEFAULT constraints on several tables and found them to exist. When trying to delete the constraints that it had found, GH specified the incorrect schema name. Upon further research, it seems the check to find the constraint:{noformat}SELECT 1 FROM SYS.OBJECTS WHERE NAME = 'df_AO_60DB71_ISSUERANKING_CUSTOM_FIELD_ID'{noformat}in a way that will return true for *any* schema name. In scenarios where there are multiple JIRA databases in the same MSSQL instance, this returns true for a *different* schema, causing AO to try to remove the constraint, doing so by specifying the working (but incorrect) schema.{noformat}java.sql.SQLException: 'df_AO_60DB71_ISSUERANKING_CUSTOM_FIELD_ID' is not a constraint.{noformat}It's all downhill from there.{noformat}IssueIndexer:thread-9 WARN anonymous 1021x18x1 1e83i9s 10.12.216.81 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [java.ao.db.SQLServerDatabaseProvider] Error in schema creation: 'df_AO_60DB71_COLUMNSTATUS_POS' is not a constraint.; attempting to roll back last partially generated table{noformat}

{panel:title=Resolution}To overcome this issue, use the following steps:
# Start with a clean, pre-upgrade backup of your JIRA
# Ensure that there is no GreenHopper artifact in {{<jira-home>/plugins/installed-plugins}}
# Ensure that your working database schema is totally empty (for best results, drop it and create a new schema)
# Restore the XML backup using JIRA
# Stop JIRA
# Remove the constraints: 
{noformat}'df_AO_60DB71_COLUMN_POS' 
'df_AO_60DB71_COLUMNSTATUS_POS' 
'df_AO_60DB71_ISSUERANKING_CUSTOM_FIELD_ID' 
'df_AO_60DB71_ISSUERANKING_ISSUE_ID' 
'df_AO_60DB71_QUICKFILTER_POS' 
'df_AO_60DB71_SPRINTMARKER_ID' 
'df_AO_60DB71_SWIMLANE_POS'{noformat}
# Start JIRA
# Install GreenHopper 6.1.2 or later{panel}
fields.summary: Upgrade task does not consider schema name when checking for DEFAULT constraints in MSSQL 2008

fields.summary: Refactor GreenHopper Ajax calls

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have some projects that multiple teams include in their agile board filter.

It seems that a team dragged a closed issue in that 'shared' project into one of their epics, and into one of their sprints.  They then removed it from their sprint.  Throughout this, it appeared to remain in our active sprint.  However their active sprint started to appear on our backlog (plan mode) with that issue in it.  It so happened that their active sprint and our active sprint had the exact same name, so that created some confusion.

"remove from sprint" was missing from the cog menu for the issue (perhaps that is not there for closed issues).  I re-opened the issue, was then able to remove it from our sprint, removed it from the other team's epic, re-add it to our sprint, and re-close it.  The other team's sprint then disappeared from our backlog.

Nothing 'bad' happened, it was just a bit confusing for team members for a while.  We were not sure if this was the product's intended behavior.

Sorry if this is a dup, I searched a bit and could not find another matching issue.
fields.summary: other teams sprints showing on my scrum board planning view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Got a report from an end customer:

In the new scrum board, plan mode, if the page is zoom in, a part of the edit issues window cannot be accessed and the story points cannot be defined (see the attached picture).

We upgraded to Greenhopper 6.1.1 a couple of weeks ago from Greenhopper 5 based release. 

Able to reproduce the issue with Firefox 18.0.1 and also Chrome on any rapid board and then zooming.  Saw that there is a related issue GHS-5666, but that has supposedly been fixed.  

One should be able to reproduce with any instance.

I see a related new report from Mozilla.org at  http://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/947443, but the problem also happens in Chrome.
fields.summary: Greenhopper 6.1.1 has problems with zooming on both FF 18 and up-to-date Chrome

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-7380].
  {panel}

After setting the flagging field to a non-empty value, the "days in column" on the card is set to 15736. This occurs when using a global loop transition to set this field via a "flagging" screen (doesn't matter if the transition takes place in the kanban view or the issue list/detail page).

Issue is self-resolved after changing the status of the card in question.

Steps to reproduce:
===============

- Create a workflow 
- Add a couple of steps
- Add a transition for one step with the same step as destination (loop transition) - doesn't need to do anything else for the purpose of reproducing the bug
- Assign a project to use the workflow
- Create a Kanban board for the workflow
- Create some issues and then use the loop transition on them
- Hover over the dots at the bottom of the issue in Work mode until the tooltip appears and it says 15000+ days (I didn't get quite the same value but it was definitely around that)

(alternatively, use the simple workflow (sw) project in the GreenHopper sample data)
fields.summary: Setting Flagging field with loop transition sets days in column to incorrect value

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I often run a filter to find a set of issues that should now be added to an active sprint. As I step through these issues it would be perfect if there was an operation I could select directly from the issue itself to add it to one of the currently active sprints
fields.summary: As a ScrumMaster I need to be able to add an issue to an active sprint directly from the issue itself

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary of bug

According to the documentation, if the 'Scheduling Permissions' checkbox is unchecked in the GreenHopper General Configuration, it should only take the 'Resolve Issues' permission into account when reordering issues. However, that does not appear to be the case.

Note that this only happens in GreenHopper Classic.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Make sure the 'Scheduling Permissions' checkbox is unchecked
# Remove the user from the 'Schedule Issues' project permission
# Ensure the user has 'Resolve Issues' permission
# Go to the Classic Planning Board, and try to change the version of a card

A video has been attached for easier replication

h3. Additional info

* This issue does not seem to happen when using the Classic Task Board, or in the agile boards
fields.summary: Unable to reorder issues even if the proper privileges are set

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Sometimes after a sprint has started, a developer is assigned an urgent bug to fix. In some cases they have already resolved the bug before the PO or SM gets around to adding it to the sprint. There is no way to add it to the sprint (as far as I can see) unless you re-open the bug, add it to the sprint, and the re-resolve it.

This seems like another example of where the new way, adds arbitrary constraints as compared to the classic approach.
fields.summary: As a Product Manager I'd like the option to see resolved items on the backlog and add them to an active sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be a great feature to be able to customize the reports generated by JIRA Agile. For example: be able to add a column on the Sprint report that displays the assignee for the issue or any other field, including Custom Fields.
fields.summary: Ability to Customize the JIRA Agile Reports

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: As in the Classic mode, applying the scrum template applies the Issue Type Scheme containing only the relevant the issue types. But in case of new Rapid boards, creating a project and board from the Getting started page creates the project with 'Default Issue Type Scheme' which includes every issue-type in the system. This is quite an overhead as for running scrum, we just need Epic, Story, Bug and Technical Task. The expectation is that the creation of project from within GreenHopper should use 'GreenHopper Issue Type Scheme' (or a new scheme dedicated for Rapid board usage).
fields.summary: As a JIRA Software Administrator Creation Of New Projects Should Use Only Required Issue Types

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At the moment, you would need to click on the swimlane issuekey to open up the short summary screen on the right of Rapid board in Work Mode to see the Story points estimation. It would be great if we can show the Story Points estimation in the swimlane view as well. The small requirement such as this could means a lot in an Agile development.

!swimlane_storypoints.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a user, to see the story points in the swimlane view in Work Mode (for Story-based swimlanes)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Verified this is a bug in Greenhopper. Steps to reproduce:
* Change machine to *Europe/Minsk*
* Add *-Duser.timezone=Europe/Minsk* into the JVM startup parameter
* Change user timezone to GMT+3
* Create a version in planning board and notice the start/end date is always one day less 

This may happen because Minsk decided to discontinue the Summer time (daylight saving time) and back to Winter time in 2011: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2625508 

Workaround:
Change the machine timezone to another GMT+3 timezone such as Asia/Bahrain.
fields.summary: greenhopper version startdate moves day back

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It is unacceptable that different boards use different information to get the connection between stories and Epics:
- the classic boards use a custom field
- the rapid boards use an issue link

The request is to update the classic boards in GH6 to use the same link as the rapid boards.

GHS-6828 (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6828) can be regarded only as a first step to bring things together.

The update procedure would then be the following:
- Update GH
- Find that the Epics in the classic boards are not connected to their stories
- Call the maintenance procedure from GHS-6828

... and have consistent data.

Having to call the Maintenance procedure from GHS-6828 regularly and manually is not an option to users which need to use both board versions:
- A change in the rapid boards would be overwritten
- A change in the classic boards would not take immediate effect on the rapid boards
- Using only one type of board is not acceptable.
fields.summary: As a user, I expect and request that all boards use the same information for the epic-story-task hierarchy.

fields.description:
As can be seen in the screenshot(s) below, the *Description* field is not shown like the default renderer from the View Issue Screen:

_Green Hopper 6.0.7_
!description_renderer_1.JPG!

_GreenHopper 6.1.1_
!description_renderer_1.JPG!

As the user would like this to be displayed just like the one in the View Issue Screen, it will be helpful if *Rapid Board* can adapt to this as well:
!view_issue_description.JPG!

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We plan our backlog out in a rolling 3 month sprint cycle. It would be nice if I could set expected sprint start and end dates as I plan in our grooming session based on the number of story points our sprint team generally gets done. 

As of now I can only set sprint start and end dates for any currently active sprints.
fields.summary: As an Agile Board user I'd like to be able to set start and end dates on sprint placeholder in Plan Mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In the plan mode of my Agile board, when I select an issue and use the function "Send to top" or "Send to Bottom" functions, nothing happens, the issue is not moved within the backlog.
It used to work in previous GH versions.
fields.summary: The "Send to Top/Bottom" function does not work any more

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In an open sprint, when I try to use the function "Remove from sprint" on an issue, the issue is not removed, and I get the following error message:
Details

        Exception: TypeError: GH.BacklogModel.getIssueListForSprint(...).getIssueCount is not a function
        Resource: http://82.244.226.156:8080/s/en_USftzjjf/772/16/741eca590a970520bb3f80cc5b49073e/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,atl.general/batch.js
        Line: 4599

Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:18.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/18.0

UPDATE: After a reboot of my PC, the function now works.
fields.summary: I cannot remove an issue from my open sprint any more
